Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2010 06:49AM Giselle4 wrote: Hi Faith, I had my Right MX  with DIEP three weeks ago. I only have one camisole and I have the one that there is pockets to hold the drains. Well all my drains are out and I am still wearing the camisole. The hospital gave me a bra with no underwire and that hooks in the front, I tried to wear that a few times but my camisole is the most comfortable. I went to this store that my hospital told me to go to purchase this type of camisole the owner set me up with just one and she told me when my drains all come out to come back and she will fit me for a bra. In a few months I will have another surgery to even out my breast so I will go back to get fitted for my final bra then. I wish I got two of the same camisole but my insurance would only pay for one so I would wear it a few days and wash, they wash really nice. My camisole brand name is an Amoena style no. 2105 Best wishes and prayers for you on your upcoming surgery. Hugs Giselle

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2010 10:22PM - edited Apr 12, 2010 10:23PM by Giselle4 Hi Joanie, I had a right MX with immediate DIep back in January. i did not have problems with anesthesia,  I had problems with the morphin. After they settled me into a room they put the morphin pump  on.  I then started to itch all over and my ears got blocked so bad that I could not hear. I started to panic. They took me off the pump and started pumping me with benadryl and thank God slowly my hearing came back.They then put me on percoset (sp) with motrin. It is now in my chart that I cannot have morphin due to that weird reaction with my hearing. I go for my stage 2 of my Diep at the end of May. I wish you a speedy recovery and hang in there with the drains. I had my in for a little over three weeks. I hope they can figure out what to do with the anesthesia before your next surgery. God Bless and Take Care Giselle
